fastNIMeansDenoisingColored

Description

Modification of fastNlMeansDenoising function for colored images.

Signature

cv2.fastNlMeansDenoisingColored(src[, dst[, h[, hColor[, templateWindowSize[, searchWindowSize]]]]]) → dst

Parameters

  • src (np.ndarray): Input 8-bit 3-channel image.
  • dst (optional; np.ndarray): Output image of the same size and type as src.
  • h (optional; float): Parameter regulating filter strength for luminance component. Bigger h value perfectly removes noise but also removes image details, smaller h value preserves details but also preserves some noise. Default value is 3.
  • hColor (optional; float): The same as h but for color components. For most images value equals 10 will be enough to remove colored noise and do not distort colors. Default value is 3.
  • templateWindowSize (optional; int): Size in pixels of the template patch that is used to compute weights. Should be odd. Recommended/Default value 7 pixels.
  • searchWindowSize (optional; int): Size in pixels of the window that is used to compute weighted average for given pixel. Should be odd. Affects performance linearly: greater searchWindowsSize - greater denoising time. Recommended/Default value 21 pixels.

Explanation

The function converts image to CIELAB colorspace and then separately denoises L and AB components with given h parameters using fastNlMeansDenoising function.

Notes

  • Performs image denoising using non-local means denoising algorithm with several computational optimizations.
  • Noise is expected to be a Gaussian white noise.
